DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the effects of a computerized working memory training program on substance abuse, psychosocial functioning, cognitive performance and psychiatric problems in adults with substance abuse and attention problems.
DOC.brief_title: Working Memory Training in Adults With Substance Abuse and Executive Function Deficits.
DOC.detailed_description: The primary aim of this study is to examine the effects of 5 weeks of computerized working memory training on substance abuse. Secondary aims are to explore whether effects are mediated by changes in executive functions and/or moderated by personality. Also, effects on measures of psychosocial functioning, depression, anxiety and attention will be explored. Follow-up assessment will be conducted at 6 months post training.
DOC.criteria: Treatment seeking adults with substance abuse and executive function deficits. Acute intoxication or abstinence symptoms of any substance. Psychosis.
